New Records: Bryce Harper reached 20 home runs for the ninth time in his career.
Bryce Harper has 15 home runs in his last 44 games.
Key Match Events: Bryce Harper homered off José Quintana (3-6) in the second inning, giving the Phillies a 2-0 lead.
Nick Castellanos hit a tying triple in the second inning.
Alec Bohm hit his 19th home run in the third for a 3-2 lead.
Bryce Harper added a two-run single in a three-run fifth that included Trea Turner’s run-scoring grounder.
Pre-Game Insights: The Phillies are closing in on an NL wild card berth.
The Phillies have not reached the playoffs in successive seasons since a five-year stretch from 2007-11.
Post-Match Reflections: Bryce Harper said he is'very fortunate' to be where he is after Tommy John surgery and is'very, very happy' with getting 20 home runs.
Zack Wheeler (13-6) improved to 4-0 in his last six starts, allowing five runs — three earned — and eight hits in seven innings.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was pushed back five hours to 6:05 p.m. EDT due to rain forecast for earlier in the day.
Buck Showalter said the plan remains for Starling Marte to rejoin the team for the final weekend of the season at home against the Phillies next week.
